>
[Longsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=386)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Versatile P" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=200" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 278 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Favored Weapon** [Aroden](/Deities.aspx?ID=512), [Falayna](/Deities.aspx?ID=471), [Good Neighbors](/Deities.aspx?ID=368), [Iomedae](/Deities.aspx?ID=285), [Lymnieris](/Deities.aspx?ID=649), [Myr](/Deities.aspx?ID=408), [Nameless](/Deities.aspx?ID=598), [Pazuzu](/Deities.aspx?ID=434), [Sithhud](/Deities.aspx?ID=438), [Teki Stronggut](/Deities.aspx?ID=505), [Titivilus](/Deities.aspx?ID=530), [Vineshvakhi](/Deities.aspx?ID=622), [Ymeri](/Deities.aspx?ID=697)

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 1 gp

**Damage** 1d8 S

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Melee

**Category** Martial

**Group** [Sword](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=15)
</row>

</column>

---

Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-15" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Weapons</title>
[Chalice of Justice](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3281), [Jian of Life's Duality](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3467), [Searing Blade](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2870), [Singing Sword](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3127)
